thumb a lift UK informal (US thumb a ride)
to stand near the edge of a road and hold out your hand with the thumb raised as a signal for a vehicle to stop and take you somewhere: thumb a lift to We thumbed a lift to London.
See more thumb your nose at someone/something
to show no respect, or to raise the end of your thumb to the end of your nose to show that you do not respect someone: He has thumbed his nose at authority all his life.
